Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gotta clear out these file cabinets people, a lot of these are dead accounts. "Scranton Mimeograph Corp?" I don't think we're doing business with them any time soon. That's odd. A letter from Robert Dunder. "A valuable artifact has come into my possession. I have hidden it until such time as a person of strong intellect may safely recover it. This golden chalice is of immeasurable historical and religious significance." The Holy Grail.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone]: Did you send Dwight on a quest for the Holy Grail?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think I'm a little too busy these days to s-- [whispering] Oh ,my God. I did send Dwight on a quest for the Holy Grail.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The Dunder Code! I completely forgot about that prank. That had to be like six or seven years ago. Stayed late every night for a month. Had a lot more free time back then.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't get it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aha! A lightbulb.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: A lightbul-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A lightbulb. Okay. Okay. [holding note over lamp] Invisible ink.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "Higher than numbers go." The ceiling above accounting!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight! Down, Dwight! Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone]: Man, I wish I was there to see his face when he gets to the end ...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...and finds the... fake grail? No grail?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You don't remember?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: An "X."

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Annex. It must open something in the annex.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "Sedes introiti." Seat of entrance.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [shouts while cutting up seat cushion - gasps upon finding playing cards]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's a flush.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [murmuring as Dwight holds up toy forklift]

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: The warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone to Jim] There's nothing down here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I expected more from young Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's just forget it. Forget it. [warehouse worker dips donut into golden chalice]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: So, how are we getting on with our grand social media initiative?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, we created a fake profile for a really cool guy named Derek McBlack.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's just Pete in sunglasses.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: And then we had him "Like" Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Then we created a bunch of fake friends for Derek, and we had all of them "Like" Derek's "Likes."

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So far, we're only popular with imaginary people, but we think this is the start of something big.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You two are geniuses. And I am a genius putting you two together.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Pete and I work well together -- not that there's anything special about Pete. It could be any guy... or girl- not that I'm into girls. Not that I'm into Pete. Ugh! What was the question?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Co-worker
Quote.Text: Hey Jim. Peter Rowley at Bridgeport Capital requested a meeting at lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Can we keep it on the early side, though? I got that thing in Scranton later.

Quote.Speaker: Co-worker #2
Quote.Text: Uh sure. No problem.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cece's ballet recital is today. I cannot wait. I've been working with her on her move. It's called the Cece Spin and Kiss. Do you want to see it? It's kind of like this. It's pretty cute, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pfft, "Athlead"? Please. They're too lazy to call it Athletes Lead? Jim should just call it "Stumpany," for "Stupid Company."

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Nothing stupid about working for yourself. Hanging out with pro athletes, getting free tickets to the games. That's why I'm doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're working for "Stumpany" too?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, just weekends for now, but pretty soon, I'm switching over.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey, Halpert, what's the big idea? First you jump ship. Now you're stealing Darryl too. When will it end?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, take your worst fear and multiply it by infinity.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You won't stop until you've poached us all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Even you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. I'll be damned if I'm gonna let us lose me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Bye, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi. How are ya? Good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Angela? Did you hear about the Irish-American Cultural Center mural?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh, I haven't heard it. So, what about the Irish-American Cultural Center mural? Potato?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no, Kevin, it's not a joke. Angela's husband put me up for a- um, just never mind.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have no information. But I'm sure as soon as they know, they'll call you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Senator Lipton helped me submit my design for a new mural on a building downtown. Now I'm just waiting to hear from the selection committee. But, you know, let's be realistic. There are a ton of great artists in Scranton with way more experience. I mean, who are they gonna go with -- some nobody like me or a big name like Tracy Fleeb?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, I'm heading out to Cece's dance recital.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Aw.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Cece, Daddy's gonna have dinner with us tonight after he comes to your recital. Are you excited?

Quote.Speaker: Cece
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Let's call him.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [line trilling]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey. I was just about to call you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Hon, are you close?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am still in Philly, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's insane. This huge investor got cold feet, so I'm stuck here trying to keep him on board.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hon, I wish you would have told me an hour ago, when you knew you weren't gonna make it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, I couldn't get out. I barely made it out just to make this phone call.

Quote.Speaker: Cece
Quote.Text: I want Daddy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're gonna do great. And you know what? Mommy's gonna record it. So we'll watch it together. Do you mind doing that, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Are you sure you know how to do video on the phone?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, Jim, I think I know how to point a rectangle at something.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, you know, just sometimes you're not the best with the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know how to operate my phone, okay? Listen, we're getting close. We will talk to you later. Say, "Bye, Daddy."

Quote.Speaker: Cece
Quote.Text: Bye, Daddy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Bye. [pause] Yep. See, you've still got to press "End," Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Cece
Quote.Text: Press "End."

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh, check it out. This is our first real "Like."

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, my gosh!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh! All right, Alan Olson from North Dakota. He also likes Hammermill and Georgia Pacific.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wow. That guy's really into paper.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well done, you two.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We did it. Youth task force forever.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: [doing a series of hand bumps with Erin] Bap, bup, bup, bap. Wait. Did I go first and then you?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, you go -- okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: All right, all right.Okay, start over.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no, no. Oh God. Andy has just started to be nice to me, I just sent his girlfriend into the arms of a younger man. "Our social media presence should be hot, hot, hot. Go at it vigorously." I did everything but unzip their pants for them. Oh, God, Nellie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, everybody. Uh, coffee order is going around -- on me. Just sign your name below.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [murmuring]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Wait. This says "Dunder Mifflin Loyalty Pledge"?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This -- uh, what? Double mocha latte, please? You got it. Just sign your name below. Whatever you want.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: "Loyalty pledge"?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Come on, Dwight, stop overreacting. I'm getting all my work done here. No customers have complained. Nobody even knows.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, we'll see about that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Bust out your complaint files. I need everything you've got on Darryl since he started working for Jim in the last few weeks. Break it down by keyword, okay? "Infuriating, irresponsible"...

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: They got us set up with Windows 95, so you're kind of dreaming here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm gonna need you to print it out.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [dot matrix printer beeping and whirring loudly]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [writing on white board] Customer Loyalty. What is it? Can you hold it in your hand? Can you nudge it with your finger? Can you dump it on a woman? No. Why? Because it's an idea. But what does it mean?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh, it's when you get a free sandwich after you've already eaten ten sandwiches.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not even close. Mr. Romanko has been a client for 20 years. He came in today in a rage. Why? Because of Darryl. Because Darryl was focusing on outside projects and needs to remember his first priority- the client.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Romanko
Quote.Text: I wouldn't say a rage.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mr. Romanko, we were a day late on one of your deliveries, but two of our trucks were down for repairs. It's very unlikely it would happen again.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Romanko
Quote.Text: Thank you. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you're not going anywhere, okay? You are angry, and we are gonna hear you out, all right? Because business is about relationships, and the key to relationships is what, Darryl? L-

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Loyalty.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Loyalty.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Loyalty is exactly right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes. I mean, it is everything. Let's all ask ourselves, have we been faithful in our relationships?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's none of your damn business.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Darryl is "dating" Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Darryl is dating Val... still.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: But he's flirting with Jim's company on the side. And we all know what flirting can lead to.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Romanko
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. Do I still need to be here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I'm having a bit of trouble understanding the importance of loyalty. So let's- let's use an example. Take Erin. Erin's boyfriend Andy, is away across the ocean.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: So is it all right for her to flirt with Creed, for example?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Let's try it out.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No, let's- let's- let's not say Creed. Let's say Mr. X.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, I think it would be immoral for Erin to cheat on Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. Didn't you cheat on Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes. And he didn't like it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Does Mr. X know that Erin has a boyfriend, or did Erin keep that from Mr. X?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay, this is really hard to follow. Can we just say Pete because that's the guy that Erin's flirting with?

Quote.Speaker: Dance Teacher
Quote.Text: Ladies and gentlemen, the Little Ladybug Ballerinas.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star plays]

Quote.Speaker: Ballerinas
Quote.Text: One, two, three.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Pam's cell phone ringing]

Quote.Speaker: Parent in Audience
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm sorry. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Ballerinas
Quote.Text: One, two, three.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] Hello? Yes, this is Pam Halpert. I got the mural? [Loudly] Oh, my God!

Quote.Speaker: Audience
Quote.Text: Shh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] Um, I'm sorry. I have to go. My daughter's a ladybug. I know that doesn't make any sense. Um, thank you, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Parent in audience #2
Quote.Text: You're very rude.

Quote.Speaker: Parent in audience #1
Quote.Text: Yes, very rude.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Shh! Kids are dancing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you so much for coming. Darryl and I will be here to serve you for years and years and years and years. [chuckles] So, should we go call Jim and tell him to go screw himself?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Dwight, look, I'm sorry you're having a hard time with this, okay? Athlead is my future. No disrespect to Dunder Mifflin, but if I can have fun at work, I want that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It can't be more fun than selling paper and paper products.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It can.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you pretending to be crazy, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, Andy's cute, but he's too vanilla, whereas Pete - he's just one sick dude. I mean, you know this guy likes to get weird.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm just gonna say this one more time. Pete and I haven't done anything.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah right. With slammin' bods like that, they ain't playing checkers.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: People, it's 2013. Erin is a strong, independent woman. Who says she has to end up with any man?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, can everyone please stop speaking for me? Andy is my boyfriend. Pete and I are just friends. And that's the end of it. Right, Pete?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: That is correct. Come on, guys, where is this even coming from?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Your feelings for Erin? Probably your heart... and a little bit your penis.

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: [groan]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Nellie, you have to shut down the task force. I'm not sure if you need to start a new task force to do that, but please just shut down the task force.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I suppose that will- that will be all right, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Most relationships eventually die on their own, but sometimes they just need a little pillow over the face. You're welcome, Andy. And you're welcome, my own ass.

Quote.Speaker: Investor
Quote.Text: Listen, I appreciate you taking the time with me.

Quote.Speaker: Co-worker
Quote.Text: Peter, please. We completely understand your concerns here. Let us just show you the latest projections. Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, Wade actually has those on the road, but he's gonna be calling in with those numbers any second. So just hold on one s-

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [cell phone vibrates]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, actually... uh, nope. That is my wife. Again, he'll be calling in any second.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] Hey, uh, give me a call back when you get a chance. Cece did great, and I want to tell you something.

Quote.Speaker: Lonnie
Quote.Text: Hey boss, you gotta jump on a delivery.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I don't do that anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Lonnie
Quote.Text: That's what they told me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: All right, let's get this over with.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You looking for fun? It just found you! Woo! [laughs] Here we go! Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, we will be delivering a shipment of paper today, but I will also be delivering you a big shipment of fun!

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [We are young plays on radio]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: How far is this place? [turns off radio]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, not far at all, but I thought along the way, we could play some sports. [throws small ball at Darryl]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Fun.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, really nice job in that meeting in there.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you. I don't know, I sort of thought-

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [hugging Nellie] So proud of you, Hon.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm just curious though, what do you have against Pete and Erin?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, Andy wrote me a really nice recommendation letter for the adoption agency, and I- I just sort of felt I owed him one.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Pete's a pretty cool guy, though, and Andy was a terrible lover to Erin. He basically ignored her and left on a boat.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I didn't really think about it like that.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, well... Not everybody has what we have.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: "What we have"?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I just remembered... I kissed that man. Oh, no. Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. Fast food. I'll take a burger over a gross Philly cheese-steak any day.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: They have fast food in Philly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not like this.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Exactly like this.

Quote.Speaker: Fast Food Worker
Quote.Text: And your milkshake.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's 30 degrees out. You drinkin' a mildshake?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nope. [throwing milkshake] Fire in the hole! [laughs] Oh, yeah! Now that's what working at a paper company's all about!

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Darryl take keys out of ignition]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, what you doing? No, I need the k- We have to go.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You just threw a milkshake in a restaurant where they make minimum wage.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a youtube thing! Let's go. Let's go. Come on, they're coming.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Anyone want to see the video from Cece's recital?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, I would love to, but I am swamped... with that [picks up piece of paper].

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll watch it. Let's get this over with.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: All right, you don't have to.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Let's get this over with, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [sound of applause on phone]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait. What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [recorded on phone] Excuse me, I have to get back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no. I took a phone call in the middle of taping, and then when I went to turn it back on, I must have turned it off.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: User error. I've heard of that happening to other people.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oscar, don't rub it in. I'm sure Pam is already kicking herself for choosing a phone call over her child.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, it was an important phone call.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I haven't told anyone here about the mural yet. I want Jim to be the first to know. Whenever I tell him good news, he's always like, "Beesly!" I love that. Only thing better than getting the job- "Beesly!" [chuckles]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hello, Peter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [cleaning up milkshake in restaurant] It barely even feels like a prank anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You missed a spot.

Quote.Speaker: Drive Thru Customer
Quote.Text: Fire in the hole! [throwing milkshake] Go! Go! Go! Go! [tires screech]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ha ha! Yeah, joke's on you buddy! They make you come back and clean it up!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I am sorry that was so awkward for you two in that meeting. But I am going to have to reassemble the youth task force.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, no, I really don't think that's a good idea.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, that is not your call. I made the decision. You have no choice in the matter, and everybody knows it.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Well, okay, then.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I guess we don't have a choice.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Lady...you never stop surprising me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [clears throat]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? What was that? Did I just hear you laughing with glee?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No. I was clearing my throat.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Night

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Night

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Night, Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [cell phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, how's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We lost Bridgeport Capital. I have no idea what happened. It's like everything I did, he just wouldn't go for it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have no idea where we're gonna come up with this money, and we have to work insanely hard over the next few weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sighs] Oh, I'm sorry. I feel like you've already been working insanely hard.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can you figure out how to upload Cece's dance recital? I definitely could use a pick-me-up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, actually, funny story -- I didn't get it. I shouldn't have been so cocky about my rectangle-holding skills after all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're not serious, are you? You didn't get any of the recital?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I got the teacher introducing them and then the applause afterwards. But not so much of the middle part.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on, Pam. Pam, I asked you if you could use the phone, and you swore that you knew how.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, okay, I'm sorry. I'm sure we can get a copy. A lot of people were taping it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, great. So we'll see somebody else's kid with Cece in the background? I mean, it's really not that hard to film a video.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is there- um... you want to ease up a little bit?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look, Pam, I don't know what to tell you. I mean, what do I do? It's gone. That moment's just gone. I missed it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know, Jim -- maybe you should have been there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're not serious, right? I mean, how is that fair? I'm in Philly. These are my days in Philly. You've agreed to this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know what? I- I- I don't think you want to start a conversation with me about what's fair. Okay? This is way more intense than I ever --

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam, I'm not explaining this to you- Pam, I'm not going over this again.

Quote.Speaker: Co-worker
Quote.Text: Jim. We need you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know how else to tell you, okay? I'm doing everything I can every week to bring home something...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I am- I am- I am trying to make everything perfect here, okay? So that you can have everything that you want.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm doing this just for me? Is that what I'm doing? I'm doing it just for me. If that's what you think, then this is a really sad night. But you know what? I got to go. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We'll talk tomorrow?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep. I'll talk to you tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. I'll talk to you tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bye. [quietly crying, sniffling]

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Hey, you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What am I doing wrong, Brian?

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Nothing. You're doing the best you can.

Quote.Speaker: Cameraman
Quote.Text: Brian.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Give her a minute. Give her a minute.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [crying]

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Hey, it's just a tough situation, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's getting tougher. I just didn't know that it was gonna be this hard.

Quote.Speaker: Brian
Quote.Text: Yeah. Let's turn the cameras off. Seriously, guys. Enough. Enough.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: [on video] Fire in the hole! Go! Go! Go! Go!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [watching you tube video, laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: [on video] I nailed that guy, dude. Oh yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: And replay.

Quote.Speaker: Guy
Quote.Text: [on video] Fire in the hole! Go! Go! Go! Go! I nailed that guy, dude. Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [sighs] I'm gonna miss the paper business.
